noun.description: A flat slab of stone, clay, or wood, used especially for an inscription.
examples: at the corner of the apse is a memorial tablet

noun.description: A small disk or cylinder of a compressed solid substance, typically a measured amount of a medicine or drug; a pill.
A small portable computer that accepts input directly on to its screen rather than via a keyboard or mouse.

origin: Middle English: from Old French tablete, from a diminutive of Latin tabula (see table).
